definition: to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
Lamp in the Side Street, novel by Qing dynasty writer Li Lüyuan 李綠園|李绿园[Li3 Lu:4 yuan2]/also written 岐路燈|岐路灯

sentences.english: The seven colors hill always have crossing.
sentences.chinese: 七色的歧路總有十字路口。

sentences.english: Chapter Three discusses Qi Lu Deng's achievements in character portrayal.
sentences.chinese: 第三章探討《歧路燈》在人物塑造方面的成就。

sentences.english: But it can also entice you into letting fantasy overcome reality, leading you down a questionable path.
sentences.chinese: 但它也能誘導你試圖以幻想替代現實，領你走上歧路。

sentences.english: He has come into this land of an hundred cross-roads.
sentences.chinese: 他已來到這個歧路百出的大地上了。

definition: to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
(lit.) the road through Yangguan 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1]/(fig.) wide open road/bright future
lit. Mt Zhongnan is a shortcut to a ministerial job (idiom); fig. to take a shortcut to promotion
